root.name: F-Zero: GP Legend
root.description: OverviewF-Zero is the seventh installment of the franchise. Developed by Suzak and published by Nintendo this futuristic racing game is sure to get your adrenaline pumping. Imagine your-self driving through tight chicanes at speeds of 900 mph. If that isn’t enough to get you pumped how about racing in a grid of 30 pilots, you against other 29? The game also has a story mode where you can choose from 8 characters; including F-Zero’s cover boyCaptain Falconand newcomer Rick Wheeler. In this mode you will face different challenges and races before you can make it to the top. Via the link cable you can challenge your friends to race to prove who the bigger man is. F-Zero GP Legend is based on the japanese anime of the same name, which aired on North America in 2003 through 2004. GameplayThe game plays much like theoriginal F-Zero andMaximum Velocitybefore it. The main Grand Prix mode is fairly simple. You chose a difficulty and a cup and race on a number of tracks until you are given a final rank. Also in the game is the Story Mode. Here, you race as 8 of the characters, watching each one of their interlocking storys as you learn of all the characters, one race at a time. Zero Test allows you too race from point A to point B, ranking you on your time. There is a number of challenges each with a pre-determined vehicle and time limit. Training Mode lets you race around every track to improve your familiarity with every stage. Opponents are optional in this mode.
